lines.text: [last lines]
[Utah, Rip and the townsmen defeat the vigilantes in the climatic gunfight]
Oh, Utah. Are you all right?
Yeah. I wanna go out and see what a town looks like when it grows up.
That's what this town's had - growin' pains. Now what are you going to do for excitement?
[first lines]
[a lynching party prepares to hang Joe Neal]
This is far enough. Easy now. If it falls off, it'll be all over. A broken neck ain't gonna get you out of this fast, Neal. Hurry it up, Bud. It'll be light soon. It's a long way back.
You'll get yours, Lud. You'll get what's comin' to ya!
Ain't nothin' comin' to me, Joe, except a large hunk of the 46-Connected. Have a nice trip, Joe.
You didn't tell me your name.
That's right, I didn't.
Are you out of your mind? You expect to hold out against Russ Nevers and his bunch all by yourself?
That's what he's payin' me for.
Who in blue blazes are you?
Blaine, Mike Blaine. Up in Alta, they started callin' me Utah.

I wish I could say there are a lot of decent people out there you're fightin' for, but I can't. They're all land hungry; they're all greedy. All you can do is teach 'em a lesson... or get yourself killed. Not much to offer a man who gets paid for using his guns.
No different anyplace. Everybody wants what he hasn't got, but it'll change. People will have to learn to live by the rules.
That won't bring my father back. It's lonely out where he is. It's even lonelier being alive.
How'd you get out of that Mexican jail, Utah?
I just told them I wanted to kill you. They let me out.
You ready?
Where we goin'?
Could be any place.
That's somewhere I've never been.
